subject: Energy Hedging & Trading/Realizing Maximum Value from Generation  May 8-11, 2007  Chicago
body:
Paradigm Courses









Paradigm Courses















  
		1. Energy Risks & Opportunities/ 2. Max 
		Value Generation
		Chicago - May 
		8-11




 
Paradigm Strategy Group, Inc., 
	the premier energy trainer, 
	proudly brings two of our special programs to Chicago, May 8-11th, designed for 
	those needing focus on the risks and opportunities of trading/hedging 
	as well as maximizing value from energy generation.


Early Bird 
	(Expires 4/6) & Special Promotions ? Click Here to Learn More

	May 8-9 ? Chicago, IL
Risks & Opportunities 
	Unique to Energy Hedging & Trading
We examine the physical dimensions of energy and some of the 
	unique risk concepts of oil, natural gas, coal, and power. Focus is placed 
	on the implications to hedging and trading strategies. Program participants 
	will learn the critical importance of integrating the physical and financial 
	aspects of energy in developing risk management strategies.

May 10-11 ? Chicago, IL
Realizing Maximum Value from Generation
The rapidly 
	emerging area of transactions involving two or more energy commodities is 
	today?s leading edge in innovative energy hedging technologies. The energy 
	business is a multiple fuel business with common dual-fuel concepts 
	including Crack Spreads, Spark Spreads and Dark Spreads.  This seminar 
	explores these and other multi-fuel transaction structures in the form of 
	swaps and options as well as dual-commodity physical supply structures (e.g. 
	selling power indexed to natural gas prices). Particular attention will be 
	focused on natural gas-power structures including Spark Spread derivatives, 
	such as those embedded in generation capacity and heat rate options.




Click Here To Download A Complete Course Brochure

These programs are 
	basic and intermediate level (group-live offering) courses with no 
	prerequisites or advanced preparation required.  
	Course 1
	CPE Credits: Marketing 2, Management Advisory Services 2, Economics 2, 
	Production 5, Specialized Knowledge & Applications 3: Total=14. 
Course 2
	CPE Credits: Marketing 2, Management Advisory Services 1, Economics 1, 
	Production 6, Specialized Knowledge & Applications 4: Total=14.

We provide practical 
      non-theoretical training in energy derivatives, and their related risk 
      management technologies.  Programs are structured to the specific needs of 
      today's dynamic energy industry and are designed to excite participants by 
      knocking down the myths and mystiques built around derivative products.  Our instructors offer participants a clear understanding of the 
      business potential arising from combining physical energy and financial 
      products.
